body.p: In developing the Phase 2 amendments, the IASB was aware that considerations similar to those discussed in paragraphs BC6.645–BC6.648 apply to designating an alternative benchmark rate as a non-contractually specified risk component in either a cash flow hedge or a fair value hedge. This is because an entity’s ability to conclude that the alternative benchmark rate meets the requirements in paragraphs 6.3.7(a) and B6.3.8 of IFRS 9 that a risk component must be separately identifiable and reliably measurable could be affected in the early stages of the reform.
